ownedComment.body: A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
The product/service profile for a specific customer or customer relationship.
Rating of the Customer or Customer Relationship for value, credit, risk and etc.

A responsibility of task (under management).
Duties are a collection of one or more responsibilities or tasks under management. (Behavior Qualifier Type)
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific Customer Relationship.
The management plan for a specific customer relationship.
An interpretation/observation on the customer's behaviour.
The action/task which is planned to develop the customer relationship.
The budget which is planned to spend for a specific customer relationship.

The course of action to realize goals (of an operational unit of an enterprise).
The management and oversight while running an operational unit of an enterprise. (Generic Artifact)

A specific Relationship (= an instance of a Relationship Class) between a specific party acting as the Bank and one or more other specific involved Parties. A Relationship is a logical unit of collaboration between two or more involved Parties.

A specific relationship between a specific Bank (= party acting as a supplier of banking services) and one or more other involved parties acting as (potential) consumers of banking services as agreed in one or more banking product or service offerings and/or agreements.
An (structured) interaction between a customer and a financial institution.

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
Unplanned interruption to a service, a reduction in the quality of a service or an event that has not yet impacted the service to the customer where this customer relationship is impacted.

A relationship between two or more parties; the parties involved are specified in terms of the roles they play in the relationship.
A Party Relationship is a connection between an instance of a Party and two or more instances of associated objects in the relationship.

Something tangible that records something, such as a recording or a photograph, or a writing that can be used to furnish evidence or information (FIBO)
Definition: A physical or digital representation of something meaningful to the audience.
Comment: 1.Technical: Manuals, instructions, tutorials, procedures, specifications, etc., that accompany a piece of equipment or software, and provide guidance for its proper use and maintenance. 2.Trading: Preparation of a set of commercial and financial documents that record or support a business transaction. International trade documentations include air waybill, bill of exchange, bill of lading, certificate of inspection, certificate of insurance, certificate of origin, commercial invoice, and consular invoice.
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/documentation.html#ixzz3EQGRGC4W
An analysis of the banking product like performance analysis
A package of services and goods, accompanied by term and condition which is offered as a whole to (internal or external) customers.

An algorithm is a step by step procedure designed to perform an operation.
Algorithms are a collection of models/calculations/algorithms that can be applied to a subject or activity. (Behavior Qualifier Type)
The action or activity of gathering information about target markets or customers.
A document associated to the product portfolio analysis like a reporting document that refers to the performance analysis of the product portfolio
A request to analize the product portfolio for example a specialist/ad-hoc request
A report resulting from market research.

Def.1 The insights derived from an analysis applied to an entity using specific models/evaluation methods
Def.2 A detailed examination of anything complex
A transaction to fulfill the product's arrangement.
Model used to analyze the product portfolio
A collection of something

A product portfolio is the collection of all the products or services offered by a company. (Investopedia)
A product portfolio is the menu of goods or services that a firm producer and offers for sale. (Investopedia)
Product Portfolio can be defined as the compilation of products and services offered by the company to the target market.

A group of customers filtered according to some criteria
A category/group/division of customers who have common characteristics.
Comment: Customer segmentation is the practice of dividing a companys customers into groups that reflect similarity among customers in each group.
Customer segmentation is the act of separating a group of clients into sets of similar individuals that are related from a marketing or demographic perspective.
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/customer-segmentation.html
Refers to the profitability and performance analysis across many possible customer segment dimensions

A specific relationship between a specific Bank (= party acting as a supplier of banking services) and one or more other involved parties acting as (potential) consumers of banking services as agreed in one or more banking product or service offerings and/or agreements.

Def.1 The insights derived from an analysis applied to an entity using specific models/evaluation methods
Def.2 A detailed examination of anything complex

An algorithm is a step by step procedure designed to perform an operation.
Algorithms are a collection of models/calculations/algorithms that can be applied to a subject or activity. (Behavior Qualifier Type)

Something tangible that records something, such as a recording or a photograph, or a writing that can be used to furnish evidence or information (FIBO)
Definition: A physical or digital representation of something meaningful to the audience.
Comment: 1.Technical: Manuals, instructions, tutorials, procedures, specifications, etc., that accompany a piece of equipment or software, and provide guidance for its proper use and maintenance. 2.Trading: Preparation of a set of commercial and financial documents that record or support a business transaction. International trade documentations include air waybill, bill of exchange, bill of lading, certificate of inspection, certificate of insurance, certificate of origin, commercial invoice, and consular invoice.
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/documentation.html#ixzz3EQGRGC4W
A customer portfolio is a segmented list of the various groups of customer
Model used in the analysis of something.
A collection of something
The action or activity of gathering information about target markets or customers.
A report resulting from market research.

A planned or performed action in the context of concluding or fulfilling an agreement.
Act to do something.
A simplified representation of reality.
A high level plan to achieve one or more goals
The rendering of a document to a medium and the transmission of the rendering via a communication channel.

A goal represents a high-level statement of intent, direction, or desired end state for an organization and its stakeholders. (ArchiMate 3.1)
An observable and measurable end result having one or more objectives to be achieved within a more or less fixed timeframe.
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/goal.html
A set of rules (e.g., regulation, policy, law, guideline, principle, standard) to guide, direct or operate a subject matter.
Rule that is played by a pecific party in a business initiative.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)

Something tangible that records something, such as a recording or a photograph, or a writing that can be used to furnish evidence or information (FIBO)
Definition: A physical or digital representation of something meaningful to the audience.
Comment: 1.Technical: Manuals, instructions, tutorials, procedures, specifications, etc., that accompany a piece of equipment or software, and provide guidance for its proper use and maintenance. 2.Trading: Preparation of a set of commercial and financial documents that record or support a business transaction. International trade documentations include air waybill, bill of exchange, bill of lading, certificate of inspection, certificate of insurance, certificate of origin, commercial invoice, and consular invoice.
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/documentation.html#ixzz3EQGRGC4W

Specific project or program undertaken to achieve specific objectives
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/initiatives.html
A set of elements (selection) filtered from a collection according to the selection criteria
A strategy to achieve the goals defined for the segment.

A Classification Hierarchy that distinguishes between locations according to specified viewpoint. Typical viewpoints are · geographical areas · political areas - countries, cities, ... · economical areas · business purposes such as sales areas · juridical areas · monetary areas · ... Often the location is used as an address to refer to the position of something. In this case Location Type can also be viewed from the perspective of "address type" such as Postal Address, or GPS-coordinates, etc.
The purpose or usage of location in relationship to the associated object like the mailing address for letters or URL for email address.
A value of Location Type expressing the place where an object can be found.
A value of Location Type expressing that a location is an area where a legal authority has Jurisdiction.
A specific role of a specific Party in the location.
Jurisdiction that will be assigned in case of legal dispute.
Nation with its own government. ISO20022
The definition of an addressable space/position both in real and virtual environments with associated uses and entitlements
A detailed characteristic of a product expressed in offered services and the terms and conditions applicable to the delivery of the services.
A set of rules (e.g., regulation, policy, law, guideline, principle, standard) to guide, direct or operate a subject matter.
A Physical or virtual space where buyers, sellers, market authorities and other market parties trade products and services according to market rules.
The involvement (role) of an instance of a party in an instance of a product.
Jurisdiction that will be assigned in case of legal dispute.
A package of services and goods, accompanied by term and condition which is offered as a whole to (internal or external) customers.
the rating/certification derived as result of an applied test assessment of an entity using specific testing criteria
The definition of an addressable space/position both in real and virtual environments with associated uses and entitlements
A pathway established via a communication medium. A contact point by which the bank interacts with parties.

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.

An interface through which parties can communicate or exchange goods or services.
Comment: A channel can be internal or external. Channel identifies the different delivery and communications mechanisms through which products, and services are made available to parties and by which the parties communicate with each other.
Examples: Shop, a web shop, email, television screens in the shops, servicedesk, e-mail, phone, …
The definition of an addressable space/position both in real and virtual environments with associated uses and entitlements
A description of the property, particularly if it has landmark characteristics.
Key dates associated with the directory entry (e.g. open date, refresh date).
The tracked status (e.g. under construction or repair, inhabited, vacant).
Type of location (e.g. building, point of interest, virtual location/device).
The planning or zoning status (e.g. residential, commercial, industrial).
The general purpose and neighborhood of the property (e.g. residential, industrial, commercial).
The construction approach for a property at the location (e.g. era and architecture as might be used in valuation).
The type of occupancy (e.g. residency, business, retail, entertainment).
The estimated (book) value of the property at the location - rental and purchase as appropriate.
An indication of the size or scale of the property where appropriate (e.g. 4 bedroom, 600 seat auditorium, 40 cover restaurant).
A brief description of the characteristics of something or someone. (Business Dictionary)
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.

The course of action to realize goals (of an operational unit of an enterprise).
The management and oversight while running an operational unit of an enterprise. (Generic Artifact)

A method for doing or achieving something, usually involving a series of actions or stages, or something you have arranged to do. (Cambridge Dictionary)
A plan is a set of intended actions, through which one intends to achieve a goal.
"Course of action" is a synonym for Plan.

A specific Relationship (= an instance of a Relationship Class) between a specific party acting as the Bank and one or more other specific involved Parties. A Relationship is a logical unit of collaboration between two or more involved Parties.

A relationship between two or more parties; the parties involved are specified in terms of the roles they play in the relationship.
A Party Relationship is a connection between an instance of a Party and two or more instances of associated objects in the relationship.
Event related to a specific Customer or Customer Relationship.

Def.1 The insights derived from an analysis applied to an entity using specific models/evaluation methods
Def.2 A detailed examination of anything complex

A contract that gives rise to a financial asset of one entity and a financial liability or equity instrument of another entity. (IFRS) https://www.iasplus.com/en/standards/ias/ias32#:~:text=Key%20definitions%20%5BIAS%2032.11%5D,equity%20instrument%20of%20another%20entity
Financial instruments are financial contracts of different nature made between institutional units. These comprise the full range of financial claims and liabilities between institutional units, including contingent liabilities like guarantees, commitments, etc. (ISO 10962)
the rating/certification derived as result of an applied test assessment of an entity using specific testing criteria

A unique and specific set of information containing the content for communications.
The term Report is mostly used as communication about a particular subject matter, often in the form of an official document, after thorough investigation or consideration by an appointed person or body.
A document containing information organized in a narrative, graphic, or tabular form, prepared on ad hoc, periodic, recurring, regular, or as required basis. Reports may refer to specific periods, events, occurrences, or subjects, and may be communicated or presented in oral or written form. (Business Dictionary)

A planned or performed action in the context of concluding or fulfilling an agreement.
Act to do something.
A collection of something
A simplified representation of reality.

An event related to the behaviour performed by an actor.
Comment: An actor can be a party or a machine An action Includes various types of requests, orders and financial transactions. Includes responses where appropriate. An action is an event which means that the concept describes the result of acting.
A high level plan to achieve one or more goals

A Classification Hierarchy that distinguishes between locations according to specified viewpoint. Typical viewpoints are · geographical areas · political areas - countries, cities, ... · economical areas · business purposes such as sales areas · juridical areas · monetary areas · ... Often the location is used as an address to refer to the position of something. In this case Location Type can also be viewed from the perspective of "address type" such as Postal Address, or GPS-coordinates, etc.
Set of integrated applications that provides centralised services such as clearing, netting, reconciliation, trading and/or settlement. (ISO20022)

An interface through which parties can communicate or exchange goods or services.
Comment: A channel can be internal or external. Channel identifies the different delivery and communications mechanisms through which products, and services are made available to parties and by which the parties communicate with each other.
Examples: Shop, a web shop, email, television screens in the shops, servicedesk, e-mail, phone, …
A Physical or virtual space where buyers, sellers, market authorities and other market parties trade products and services according to market rules.
A group of products filtered according to some criteria
A package of services and goods, accompanied by term and condition which is offered as a whole to (internal or external) customers.
The identifier of product e.g. ISIN Code.
Specifies the category/type/class of product like financial product. Product can be categorized according to different perspectives.
Refers to the lifecycle of a product (e.g., initiated, announced, active, obsolete, withdrawn).
A detailed explanation or commentary of product.
A set of elements (selection) filtered from a collection according to the selection criteria

A group of customers filtered according to some criteria
A category/group/division of customers who have common characteristics.
Comment: Customer segmentation is the practice of dividing a companys customers into groups that reflect similarity among customers in each group.
Customer segmentation is the act of separating a group of clients into sets of similar individuals that are related from a marketing or demographic perspective.
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/customer-segmentation.html
A specific party who plays a specific role in the custome segment like the bank who defined the customer segment

A group of market filtered according to some criteria
An identifiable group of individuals, families, businesses, or organizations, sharing one or more characteristics or needs in an otherwise homogeneous market. Market segments generally respond in a predictable manner to a marketing or promotion offer (Business Dictionary) .... Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/market-segment.html
A market segment is a group of people in a homogeneous market who share common marketable characteristics (Investopedia). https://www.investopedia.com/terms/m/market-segment.asp
The criteria for a market segment are that there is homogeneity among the segment's main needs, the segment must be unique, and the segment's members must produce a common reaction to marketing tactics.
Common market segment traits include interests, lifestyle, age, and gender.

A product portfolio is the collection of all the products or services offered by a company. (Investopedia)
A product portfolio is the menu of goods or services that a firm producer and offers for sale. (Investopedia)
Product Portfolio can be defined as the compilation of products and services offered by the company to the target market.

A specific relationship between a specific Bank (= party acting as a supplier of banking services) and one or more other involved parties acting as (potential) consumers of banking services as agreed in one or more banking product or service offerings and/or agreements.
A customer portfolio is a segmented list of the various groups of customer

Functional classification of the product
-Refer to Specification for the description of banking products or services (BPoS)
